text: On tap at Grünerløkka mat- og mikrobryggfestival 2015. Hazy golden body, white head. Aroma of caramel malt, earthy hop tones. Taste is lightly sweet with grain, dry bitterness with a crisp finish.

Draught at All In Beer Fest 2015, cons 2015-11-06 Göteborg 
AR: wee white oaky, white grapes, Muscat
AP: hazy golden, white foam
F: dry, white grapes, Muscat, dry

On tap at Whats Brewing Beer Festival 2015, Stavanger. Pours deep golden with white head. Some DMS, but still OK, some sulfur. Almost no sweetness, bitter taste, some bitter, very dry finish. Would have liked more malt sweetness and some hop aroma.

Cervesa amb un aroma i gust clarament a cereal amb tocs a galeta, molt recomanable.
Cerveza con un aroma y sabor claramente a cereal con toques a galleta, muy recomendable.

On tap @ Beaverton Brewery, London - UK. Color: cloud blond golden beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: domination of grain and sweet honey notes. Small caramel finish. Taste: medium body, with sweet honey grains taste. Really nice body and quiet drinkable. Good sweet caramel finish. Small alcohol notes. Aftertaste: sweet caramel and honey.

From bottle at Bevog 2nd anniversary. Pours a slightly hazy golden color, topped with a medium sized white head. Mild aroma with a hint of honey notes. Mildly sweet with medium bitterness. A bit of resin presence, but not too much. Fresh and semi-light but with lots of taste.
Keg at spitfire.. Golden amber... Thin white lacing... Soft Dry fruit.. Lightest hay nose... Soft toffee fruit.. Light floral hay
Keg at spitfire. Pours golden, nose is floral, toffee, taste is similar, dry, bitter, not bad.

Keg at the brewery tap room, London. It pours a slightly hazy pale golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is fresh citric and grassy hops with grains and straw. Taste is crisp and bitter, citrusy grassa and lightly tangy. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very tasty and no overly sweet or boozy.

Keg at the brewery during the Lervig Tap takeover. 25/04/2015. Translicent golden yellow coloured pour with a lasting white head. Aroma is big spicy nobel hop, quite sweet, spicy orange peel, some hot alcohol, sweaty grains, . Flavour is composed of sold base grains, slightly nutty, spicy tangerine, pils cereal, spicy orange peel. Palate is semi-sweet,medium /full bodied, highish carbonation.
On tap at Biercab. Orange colour with white head. Fruity, pineapple, butter and yeast aroma. Sweet, fruity, pineapple, hoppy, butter taste. Medium body.

Keg at Cotteridge Wines Tasting room; clear golden amber pour with a frothy white head, pine and sweet malt aroma, taste has tangerine, fresh pine, well balanced sweet malts, wild carbs, loving these hoppy pils.
Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours hazy amber. Nose is sweet fruits, orange, wet grass, vegetables. Taste is caramel, tangerin, toffee, light boozy, grapefruit, citrus. A bit boozy.
Keg hand drawn monkey Huddersfield. Hazy gold good lasting white head. Aroma is tropics. Taste same nice sweet pale malts light hoppy bitters. Ok body. Decent easy to drink.

Tap, at the brewery. Clear gold. Thin, lasting, white head. Crisp, clean, grainy malts. Grassy hop. Nicely skunky. Taste is mostly dry, with a lemon hop bitterness. Finishes dry, with a nicely crunchy bitterness.

27th April 2015Mother Kellys. Keg. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and a little soft but there is decent fine carbonation. Semi sweet pale malts, trace of dry cream. Hops are a little skunky and with a nice resinous piney orange and marmalade. Decent hop spice. Light semi dry finish. A fine beer but not really getting much Pils character. Do I care? Not so much!

Keg frome the Fire Engine at Beavertown - we need more of these ! 25/04/15.
Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white head that clears to spotting.
Nose is orange pith, straw, lemon rind, light caramel, toasted malt.
Taste comprises mandarin, straw, bitter citric peel, light grapefruit, orange pith, hint of pine needle.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a juicy hop wash,
Decent hopped up pils - refreshing stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at Mother Kellys - London. Pours deep orange-gold with a creamy white head. The aroma has some grainy pale malts, ripening citrus, lemon. Medium sweet acor with rich bready malt character, mild dough, citrusy hops, malt. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Sweet and bready to finish with troubles of honey, caramel, dough, ripe citrus. Interesting. Kind of like a lightly hopped malt liquor. Novel.

Keg at Mother Kellys. It pours lightly hazy orange with a decent white head. The nose is soft, doughy, creamy, grassy, floral, sweet bread, honey suckle and passion fruit. The taste is crisp, bitter-sweet, doughy, candied citrus peel, sugared fruits, light alcohol, minerals and cereal with dry, sort of sweet finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. A touch too sweet, but good boost anyhow.

Draught. Pours cloudy orange with a non-lasting off white head. Flowery aroma, bitter hops, pine, grass, citrus. Taste is of citrus fruits, pine, light malty biscuit taste. Really refreshing. Loved this.

My 900th tick on Rate Beer had to be something special so they launched this and I thought hell yes. Im down with it. 

Nice tropical fruits on aroma. Lychees. Lime. Lemons. Grapefruit Taste is grapefruit, lychee, bubblegum and clove. Very well balancedn. Pilthy. Pine. So damn drinkable. Great pilsner malt. Absolutely epic. So drinkable for the style.
